intro: Monotagma juruanum, commonly known as the Jurua sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in the Amazon Basin. The plant typically grows in sandy or well-drained soils and is adapted to the humid tropical climate. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, while its flowers are usually pink or purple, adding ornamental value. It is often used in horticulture for its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in specific ecological conditions.
